doc.field: - Bermuda Star Line Inc said it has leased a 23,500 ton passenger vessel from Orley Shipping Co Inc, of Liberia for a term with options extending for 15 years. The vessel, SS Liberte, will be renamed the Canadian Star and will be used for cruises to Montreal from New York, beginning in June. Orley SHipping is partially owned by Common Brothers PLC, a U.K. maritime firm which owns 60 pct of Bermuda Star's shares and arranged debt financing for the ship's purchase. Orley acquired the vessel from Banstead Shipping Ltd. Terms were not disclosed.
